titleStmt.title: Description of University of Pennsylvania Oversize Ms. Codex 243: Leticha /

notesStmt.note: Title from opening rubric (f. 1r): Qui comenza lo libro chiamato leticha del magnio filosefo Aristotile pieno de moralita Iesus Cristus.
Many stains and smudges. Slight wormhole damage, obliterating a few words of text on the first few folios. Edges starting to fray and tear in a few places. Binding and cover in good condition.

This text, with contemporary foliation 1-33, is missing its final leaf and was once followed by a treatise on the cardinal virtues based on Valerius Maximus and others, foliated 35-67, now the Beinecke Rare Book & Manuscript Library's Marston 43 (Eugenio Refini, University of Warwick).

msIdentifier.repository: Kislak Center for Special Collections, Rare Books and Manuscripts

msContents.summary: Italian compendium of Aristotle's Nichomachean ethics.

supportDesc.extent: 33 leaves : 285 x 197 (208 x 115) mm. bound to 293 x 201 mm

collation.p: Paper, i (modern paper) + 33 + i (modern paper); 1¹²(+1), 2⁵, 3⁵; 1-33; contemporary foliation in ink, upper right recto.

layoutDesc.layout: Written in 46 long lines; ruled in lead; some prickings visible.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Written in a humanistic script by a single hand.

decoDesc.decoNote: Contains 46 large decorated initials throughout, in a variety of colors; decorated with complicated interlacings of serrated branchwork with cone-like fruit; two of the initials have a small coat of arms in the center (f. 1r, 15v); headings to the prologue and the various sections written in red, purple and green; capitals touched with yellow.
Zoomorphic initial, Initial C, Dragons, f. 4v
Zoomorphic initial, Initial S, Dragons, f. 8r
Zoomorphic initial, Initial S, Dragons, f. 22r

history.provenance: Gift of Charles W. Burr, 1938 (bookplate, inside upper cover).
